Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Endless Peril
Description:
A perfect expansion set for fans of Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress, this card pack provides you with 30 new exploration cards to shuffle into your existing deck. Comprising 15 challenge cards and 15 combat cards, Endless Peril will add a whole new dimension to your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Advanced Arsenal
Description:
A perfect expansion set for fans of Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress, this card pack provides you with 24 new resource cards to shuffle into your existing deck. Comprising 4 new cards for each of the six ships that regularly dock at Precipice – Steed of Mathurir, Long Hauler Gamma-3-Beta, Traveller, Vanguard, Clarion and Kravv’Cha’To – Advanced Arsenal will add a whole new dimension to your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Too Many Bones: Dart
Description:
A former lab employee who saw any number of atrocities, Dart escaped Nobolous' employment with the help of the pigadillo she befriended in the baddie pens.

With a penchant for pharmaceutical concoctions and an unstable side (literally), this new Gearloc add-on for Too Many Bones and Undertow is one of our most unique gearlocs to date.

With dice that work differently from front side to back side, Dart has solid crowd control as well as a mean streak if you are able to time things correctly. Bottom line, Dart brings a host of unique gameplay options to the TMB series.

—description from the publisher

Name: Too Many Bones: Lab Rats
Description:
Enhance your Too Many Bones experience by adding The Lab Rats! The Rats are our first ever multi-Gearloc...Gearloc! Slank, Gerbil, Flan, and Helix all bring unique stats to the table while utilizing a group pool of 16 Skill dice! Swapping the proper character in and out equipped with the proper equipment for the situation creates a brand new brain-bending approach to existing TMB strategies.

The Lab Rats come with 21 beautiful custom dice, nine chips (one for each intern and five 3HP chips), a closable dice holder, and four edge-stitched neoprene character mats.

—description from the publisher

Name: Politisk Ukorrekt Billeder
Description:
Remake of Politisk Ukorrekt with pictures; match a picture with more or less inappropriate captions.

—user summary

Name: Pun
Description:
Components: 54 (2 × Alphabet/2 × Pun)

Object of the game

The object of the game is to form one or more words on your own hand. The score of a word results from the number of letters. Example: The word "GAME" consists of four letters and thus results in four points. The words "TURN" and "CARD" result in four plus four points, i.e. a total of eight points. The player with the most points on his hand wins.

Pun Rules

The starting order can be determined by lots. The player who draws the highest card in the alphabet begins. First, each player is dealt six cards face down. The remaining cards are dealt face down in the center as the deck. Three cards from the deck are dealt face up in the center. There must always be three cards in the center throughout the game.

Phase 1
The active player may swap an unlimited number of cards with the other players in the first phase. You may also exchange several cards for one.

Phase 2
The active player can then choose between these three options:
1. The player can swap one or more cards from the center with those in his hand and then end his turn.
2. The player can draw a card from the deck and end his turn. This option cannot be selected if there is no more card in the deck.
3. The player can end the round. This ends his turn. The round continues until  all other players have completed their turn Now the points of each player are counted.

All words in the dictionary are allowed. Abbreviations and names are not allowed. Players can also agree to allow words in other languages or limit themselves to terms from a specific subject area (e.g. animals). The „Pun- card“ is the wild card and can represent any one of the 26 letters.

-description from designer

Pun Spielanleitung

Karten: 54 (2 × Alphabet/2 × Pun)

Anleitung: Deutsch und Englisch

Anzahl Spieler: 2–8

Altersgruppe: ab 6 Jahren

Autor: Bastian Ruhl

Ziel des Spiels

Ziel des Spiels ist es, ein Wort oder mehrere Wörter auf der eigenen Hand zu bilden. Die Punktzahl eines Wortes ergibt sich aus der Anzahl der Buchstaben (also jeder Buchstabe ist grundsätzlich gleich viel Wert). Beispiel: Das Wort „SPIEL“ besteht aus fünf Buchstaben und ergibt somit fünf Punkte. Die Wörter „ZUG“ und „KARTE“ ergeben drei und fünf Punkte, also insgesamt acht Punkte. Derjenige Spieler, der am Ende die meisten Punkte auf der Hand hat, gewinnt.

Finaler Sieger: Man kann danach Spielen wer nach einer bestimmten Anzahl an Runden die meisten Punkte hat oder wer der Sieger der meisten Runden ist.

Pun-Spielregeln

Wer anfängt, kann ausgelost werden. Der Mitspieler, der die höchste Karte im Alphabet zieht, beginnt. Zuerst bekommt jeder Spieler sechs Karten verdeckt ausgeteilt. Die restlichen Karten werden, als Stapel verdeckt, in die Mitte gelegt. Drei Karten vom Stapel werden offen in die Mitte gelegt. Während des gesamten Spiels müssen immer drei Karten in der Mitte liegen. Der Spielzug eines Spielers besteht aus zwei Phasen.

Phase 1

Der aktive Spieler darf in der ersten Phase mit den anderen Spielern unbegrenzt viele Karten tauschen (verbal und darf verdeckt oder offen stattfinden). Es dürfen auch mehrere Karten gegen eine getauscht werden (bis man selbst nicht mehr tauschen möchte oder die anderen Spieler nicht mehr tauschen möchten). Das Tauschen von Karten ist ein wichtiges strategisches Element und sollte nicht vernachlässigt werden.

Phase 2

Anschließend muss sich der aktive Spieler zwischen drei Möglichkeiten entscheiden:

1. Er kann eine oder mehrere Karten aus der Mitte mit denen auf seiner Hand tauschen und den Zug beenden.

2. Oder der Spieler kann eine Karte vom Stapel ziehen und den Zug beenden. Diese Option ist nicht wählbar, wenn keine Karte mehr im Stapel ist.

3. Der Spieler kann das Spiel beenden. Dadurch ist der Zug beendet. Das Spiel läuft noch eine Runde weiter und endet, sobald der Spieler, der es beendet hat, wieder am Zug wäre. Nun werden die Punkte gezählt.

Die Umlaute Ä, Ö, Ü werden durch AE, OE, UE gebildet und das áºž durch SS. Alle im Duden stehenden Wörter sind erlaubt. Abkürzungen und Namen sind hingegen nicht gestattet. Die Spieler können sich aber auch darauf einigen, Wörter anderer Sprachen zu erlauben oder sich nur auf Begriffe aus einem bestimmten Themenfeld zu beschränken (z. B. Tiere) (siehe Spielmodus “Stadt, Land, Pun). Die Pun-Karte ist der Joker und kann einen der 26 Buchstaben vertreten.

Es können auch Karten aus dem Deck genommen werden (empfiehlt sich Q, X, Y rauszunehmen, wenn man nur einsprachig deutsch spielt).

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Raptor (Assault/Combat)
Description:
The Raptor is designed to play multiple roles, ranging from reconnaissance and scouting, to supporting missions with electronic countermeasures and deploying additional firepower. It is slower and less maneuverable than a Viper, but it is capable of short-range FTL jumps and can be armed to fight back Cylons.

The Raptor Assault/Combat can be equipped with additional internal and external armaments on the fuselage and wings, such as autocannon and missile pods, for defensive and offensive operations where combat is to be expected.

Contents:

1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Boomer Raptor
Description:
The Raptor is designed to play multiple roles, ranging from reconnaissance and scouting, to supporting missions with electronic countermeasures and deploying additional firepower. It is slower and less maneuverable than a Viper, but it is capable of short-range FTL jumps and can be armed to fight back Cylons.

Sharon “Boomer” Valerii is one of the best Raptor pilots in the fleet, serving for two years on the Galactica, when she was still unaware of her identity as a Cylon infiltrator. This pack includes Boomer’s pilot card and skill cards.

Contents:

1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Cylon Heavy Raider (Combat/Transport)
Description:
The Heavy Raider is a Cylon multifunctional spacecraft, used to attack colonial ships and transport Cylon fighters on boarding missions. Like a Cylon Raider, this spacecraft is sentient and self–flying. It can also be piloted by Centurions or human–form Cylons, but its lack of windows forces the pilot to rely on electronics only to navigate.

The Heavy Raider Combat/Transport has a thick armor, can resist intense enemy fire, and it is equipped with more powerful weaponry than a standard Raider. It’s also a troop transport, perfect to carry Centurions onto planet surfaces or aboard human Battlestars.

Contents:
1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Cylon Heavy Raider (Veteran)
Description:
The Heavy Raider is a Cylon multifunctional spacecraft, used to attack colonial ships and transport Cylon fighters on boarding missions. Like a Cylon Raider, this spacecraft is sentient and self–flying. It can also be piloted by Centurions or human–form Cylons, but its lack of windows forces the pilot to rely on electronics only to navigate.

The Veteran Heavy Raider is well–armed, carrying tri–barreled automatic cannons, which are able to sustain high rates of fire, and can equip ship–to–ship missiles. It is lethal in dogfights and can be converted into anti–aircraft batteries for attacks on planetary surface.

Contents:
1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards

Name: Billions Below
Description:
Billions Below is the Ultimate Game of Chance and Discovery! Each player gets $500 Million to actively Bid against each other for control of Oil and Mining Explorations across (17) countries Worldwide!

Players Roll Dice and Draw Cards to Bid, Make Discoveries, and Earn Royalties (Money)!

Players also encounter Political Hurdles (War, Taxes, Corruption) that can destroy their investments.

The Richest Player after 60 Minutes Wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Heavy Raider (Captured)
Description:
The Heavy Raider is a Cylon multifunctional spacecraft, used to attack colonial ships and transport Cylon fighters on boarding missions. Like a Cylon Raider, this spacecraft is sentient and self–flying. It can also be piloted by Centurions or human–form Cylons, but its lack of windows forces the pilot to rely on electronics only to navigate.

The Heavy Raiders can be controlled by human pilots. Caprica’s Sharon (Boomer’s clone) stole a Heavy Raider to rescue Starbuck from a Cylon base and escape to Kobol. This pack includes cards to represent her when she became a Colonial pilot, with the callsign “Athena,” and the ship cards to play the model as either a Colonial or Cylon ship.

Contents:
1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards

Name: Poteen
Description:
In Poteen collect a set of each Step Cards (Barley, Malting, Brewing) to exchange for a Poteen Barrel card. Along the way, avoid Garda Siochana Cards and resolve any Event Cards that appear. Be the first player to collect 3 Poteen Barrel Cards (3-4 players) or 5 Poteen Barrel Cards (2 players) and you win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Galeão Fantasma
Description:
Galeão Fantasma (Ghost Galleon)

There are reports of mysterious events at Perna de Pau's Cove. 
Are numerous rumors that the Ghost Galleon, with a valuable cargo of gold coming from Spain, has just reappeared by the beach. 
Rival area pirates are immediately scheduled on a plank and steal the treasure hidden behind the stories of the ghost of the Blackbeard, who presents himself in its protected and invaluable treasure.
Who is the first pirate with enough courage to go to the Ghost Galleon, search all my treasure chests for the treasure and take him to his hiding place?

Goal of the game
Be the first pirate to return to his hiding place with the gold pieces of the treasure.

How to play

Moving your pirate
Roll two dice and advance as many houses as the sum of both dice.
 You can not go to another pirate's hideaway.

Caves
There are four caves on the beach (marked with lanterns) with secret passages between them. Allow skirted the board faster.

The approach to the Ghost Galleon
Follow the black arrow on the beach to opposite black arrow. 
Go around the galleon in the same direction as you walked along the beach.

The Ghost of the Blackbeard
You can move it whenever you get a 6 at the die roll. Use it to help you get in the way of the others.
He can never leave Galleon.

Houses with cannon and houses with cannonballs
To shoot a cannon, the Phantom must move to the house directly behind that cannon.

Board
When the Phantom comes home next to yours (he can stop there even if he has not finished the sum of the data), or when you arrive at a house after his, or if you are in a cabin when he enters, you are immediately taken spiritually to walk on the board, Ha, ha, hal !! 
When you have recovered from the shock (ie lost in turn), you are saved by a barrel passing through there. Jump to the barrel of your color and start your journey from there.

Search and Obtaining the Treasure
You must keep one or more keys that will open the treasure chests.

Entrance into the Haunted Cabin
Enter the path of the door (marked with an arrow). You can not enter if the Ghost or other pirate there.
Remove the round silhouette from the top of the hill. Hold any key face down or the Parrot with face up in front of you.
Devessair and re-enter the Haunted Cabin in new turns if you want to catch another circular silhouette.

The parrot
When you catch the Parrot, immediately:

     withdraws at random any silhouette belonging to another player;
     remove a key from the Haunted Cabin, even if there is the Ghost;
     look under any of the chests to see which key opens and future references.


In subsequent times, the player who has the Parrot may prefer not to cast the dice, but to repeat 1, 2 or 3.

The Ghost of the Blackbeard and his Parrot
If the Ghost moves to next to the pirate who has the Parrot, the Blackbeard sends the parrot back to the Haunted Cabin, where it is placed on the top of the hill of circular silhouettes. Then the pirate walks on the board!

Entrance into the booths with treasure chests
Enter in the same way as described for Haunted Cabin
The bottom of each ark shows what key is needed to open it. Remember this for future references, or if you already have a matching key (with 2 or 3 teeth) prove it to the other players showing them your key and the bottom of the ark. Then open the ark, secretly remove the silhouette (if you still there is one) look at it and keep it face down in front of you. Replace the lid on the chest and
put it back in the cabin. One of the chests does not need a key - just remove the silhouette.
The split key is unnecessary and does not open any ark!

Duels
Duels are an exciting way to gain weapons, treasure, keys and the Parrot of other pirates.
If you wish to challenge an opponent to a duel, move to the house next to his (do not need to come with exact number) and shout: "Choose the weapons"! You can not challenge him to a duel if he's in a cabin or in his refuge.
Both display the silhouette of a weapon, face up, if you have it. Then roll the dice to decide the outcome of the duel:
 * a player with a pistol throws the three dice.
 * a player with a sword throws two dice.
 * a player without weapons or with a broken sword casts a die.

The highest value of a single dice designates the winner.
The winner removes any of the silhouettes or the parrot (if any) from the loser along with both weapons used in the duel.
The winner can then, if he wishes, change places with the loser.

Winner of the game
The first pirate to arrive at his own refuge, having found the treasure is the winner.

Name: Tiny Epic Tactics: Lanterns Mini Expansion
Description:
The Lanterns mini-expansion adds a 'pick up and deliver' like mechanism to Tiny Epic Tactics furthering the options and replayability of the game. During the game's setup, each village is given an unlit lantern (backside of the token). When a player sends one of their heroes through a portal (cave) they come out with a torch. A player can only have one of their heroes holding a torch at any given time. If a hero takes damage while holding a torch, the torch goes out. If a hero brings a torch to a village and lights the lantern of that village, the player who controls that hero collects the lantern for victory points at the end of the game.

Note: This mini expansion is packaged inside the Deluxe Edition.  Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.

Name: Wig Masters
Description:
Wig Masters is a game for 2-4 players in which 
players take on the roles of wig merchants competing in the high stakes world of powdered wig sales.
  Wear your various fancy wigs to influence the ever changing wig market whilst buying and selling fancy wigs. Players must buy wigs when they are cheap and sell them when they are fashionable to make the most money and win.
  The game is a streamlined stock market game in which players will buy low and sell high from the market to earn money.
  Each Round consists of four phases;

     Players choose a wig to wear for the Round that will determine their turn order and special ability.
     Market demand is determined.
     Players sell wigs to the market.
     Players buy wigs from the market.


Simple rules, deep strategy, brisk playtime. 
 —description from the publisher

Name: Artipia Games: The Promo Pack
Description:
6 promos (9 cards in all) for 6 of Artipia's games that was Kickstarted as a result of having their cash stolen from them at Essen Spiel fair 2018.

These were all packaged together in a cellophane bag.

This expansion includes promo cards for:

Among the Stars (2 cards)
A Thief's Fortune: Prevent Robbery (1 card)
Fields of Green (3 cards)
Kitchen Rush (1 card)
The Pursuit of Happiness (1 card)
Whoosh: Bounty Hunters (1 card)

Name: Affectionate: Cats and Cuddles – It's Treat Time!
Description:
The It's Treat Time expansion adds some more components to the bag of Affectionate: Cats and Cuddles: 1 Rulebook, 5 Cat Mats, 5 Cat pawns, and 1 Reference Mat.

It's Treat Time;; provides two new ways to play Affectionate: an Advanced version introducing a new mechanic - dice drafting (choosing dice from a common pool in turn order) and the "It's Treat Time" Expansion which adds the mechanic of worker placement - using a pawn to choose from a limited number of actions. 

With It's Treat Time, Affectionate is not only a light, fun game, but a way to introduce game mechanics and concepts to younger or less experienced players.

Even with all of these additions, Affectionate: Cats and Cuddles & It's Treat Time Expansion is a light, silly game about being the sweetest cat in the house and its expansions brings new ways to play this simple, sweet game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Whoosh: Bounty Hunters – Kickstarter Promo Card
Description: Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign.

Name: Sembrando Agua
Description:
AguÌˆita is the protector of watersheds and teaches people to inhabit them in Peru means being exposed to multiple hydrometeorological dangers.
helps AguÌˆita management to the watershed, using the best strategy to win the game. Beware of floods and droughts, use prospective corrective and reactive management charts to be the first to manage disaster risks in your watershed.

shuffles risk management cards, hazard tiles and vulnerability cards separately. Place the danger tiles face down in the center of the table and unfold 5 cards on the side of the table, then place the risk management deck on the side of the tile deck and deal 4 cards to each player; Place the vulnerability cards on one side of the table, these cards will be used only when one of the players manages to complete a watershed.

—description from the designer

Name: Diwali
Description:
The festival of lights is getting closer. You can breathe happiness in the streets, and at any corner, the emotion is contagious for the great moment coming. Players represent fireworks merchants, who like every year, take advantage of the festivity to offer to the curious and devout the fireworks that will give color and joy to the most colorful party of the year.

On your turn; You can expand your gunpowder factories, producing, open a stall in the market to sell your products and go out calling new customers. You have to keep an eye on what your competitors do; since each night, the scoring phase takes place and only those stalls that satisfy the demand of the clients, as well as those who can fill the sky with colors by shooting their fireworks, will score.

The game lasts 4 rounds and the player with the most points will be declared the winner.

Happy Diwali

—description from the designer

Se acerca la fiesta de las luces. Ya se respira alegria en las calles y en cualquier rincón la emoción se contagia para el gran momento que esta por llegar.  Los jugadores representan mercaderes de fuegos artificiales, que, como cada año, aprovechan la festividad para ofrecer a los curiosos y devotos los fuegos artificiales que darán color y alegría a la fiesta más colorida del año.

En tu turno; podrás ampliar tus fabricas de pólvora, producir, abrir tus puestos en el mercado para vender tu producción y salir a captar nuevos clientes. Tienes que estar atento a lo que hacen tus competidores; pues cada noche tendrá lugar una fase de puntuación. Aquellos puestos que puedan satisfacer la demanda de los clientes asi como aquellos que llenen de colores el cielo con sus fuegos artificiales podrán puntuar.

Al cabo de 4 rondas, el jugador con mas puntos será declarado ganador.

Feliz Diwali.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Paper Against The Office (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
This is an Unofficial Expansion for a similar game. based on the much loved TV series, the Office. I made these cards in photoshop as a birthday gift for my wife and decided to share them with the world! Thousands of people have since enjoyed them!

It contains 180 original cards based on The Office TV show.  (144 white, 36 black)

—description from the publisher

Name: Paper Against The Office 2 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
It's back!  We have released PART 2 to our popular game Paper Against The Office!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

8 if the white cards are blank on the front so that you can add your own favorite office parts to your set!

—description from the publisher

Name: Parks Against Recreation (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
A brand new game from the creators of Paper Against The Office!  Parks Against Recreation is the next great game you should have on your shelf at home!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

—description from the publisher

Name: Welcome To...: Halloween & Christmas Lights Thematic Neighborhoods
Description:
Two thematic neighborhoods packaged together for "Welcome To" - Halloween and Christmas Lights.

Welcome To... Halloween : go trick or treat in your neighborhood. Collect ghost to gain new effects and candies to earn more points.

Welcome To... Christmas Lights : try to become a friendly neighborhood by adding Christmas lights to your streets and earn points for the longest light you create.

-description from publisher

Name: Awesomeness is Lowell
Description:
A fun filled, exciting game of touring historic Lowell, Massachusetts visiting historic sites, local businesses & collecting souvenirs. Be part of the famous Lowell Kinetic Sculpture Race, Walk through Kerouac Park, Visit Whistler's House, or Enjoy an outside concert at Boarding House Park.

Players move around a board of historic places in the city of Lowell, MA.  They are tourists collecting special souvenirs that they will then get to keep when they finally return home.

The object of the game is to tour Lowell, visit the 6 historic sites with the green bar above and purchase a souvenir. The first tourist to collect all 6 different souvenirs and return home wins.

Name: triiips
Description:
triiips is a simple, elegant game played with 54 tiles, each with 3 properties… color, shape and fill.

With 3 tiles in your hand, play 1, 2 or 3 tiles to the grid. Any lines you create or extend must have at least one property which is the same on each tile or different on each tile.

Score 1 point for each tile in any line you create or extend on your turn. If a tile is part of 2 lines, count it twice. That is your base score for the turn.

Double it for playing at least one of 3 tiles in a row in which two properties are either the same on each tile or different on each tile.

Triple it for creating a triiip… 3 tiles in a row in which all three properties are either the same on each tile or different on each tile.

Multipliers compound so a well played turn can change things in a hurry.

—description from the designer

Name: Last Word Standing
Description:
Last Word Standing pits 2 to 6 players against each other in a fast-paced war of the words! Players use letter cards to spell high-value words that beat out the competition to the highest score — or else lose half their own points in the fray! With action cards to turn the tables, swap cards, steal letters, and more, whether you're a quick speller or a long-term strategizer, in the end, it's not about who's the wordiest, but just who has the last word standing!

—description from the publisher

Name: The 7th Guest: Infection
Description:
Based on the infamous and diabolically challenging microbe puzzle from The 7th Guest, this beautifully designed game consists of a quality 15" x 11" roll-up board, 49 double-sided microbes, 5 anti-bodies (optional play), a black velvet drawstring pouch and instructions. It's a game that anybody can learn to play in minutes but spend a lifetime mastering and will be a great addition to your tabletop strategy game collection.

The board is a square grid divided into 7 rows and 7 columns. Each player begins with two microbes, colored blue or red. The microbes are placed at the four corners of the grid, with blue in the top left and bottom right corners, while red occupies the other corners. Red takes the first turn. During a turn, a player may move one of their microbes one or two spaces in any direction, including diagonally. If the player moves to an adjacent space, a new microbe is created on the space the microbe moved from. If the player moves to a non-adjacent space, the space on which the microbe began the turn remains empty. Any of the opponent's microbes which are in spaces adjacent to the space a player moves onto will be "infected," turning to the color of the player who has moved. Players are required to move unless no legal move is possible. The game is over when either all cells of the board are filled or all microbes on the board are the same color. The player with the most microbes on the board at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: War of Three Kingdoms: The Card Game
Description:
War of Three Kingdoms: The Card Game, based on the SEGA video game Sangokushi Taisen, takes place during a legendary period in history in which the kingdoms of Wei, Shu, and Wu openly warred for control of ancient China. Now you have the chance to build your chosen kingdom by strategically selecting the heroic generals and tactics that will comprise your deck and lead you to victory over your rivals.

War of Three Kingdoms: The Card Game includes three fully playable factions, comprised of three hundred cards, and each player controls one of these factions and constructs their own deck to wage war against one another for dominion over ancient China.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Dice Hospital: Kickstarter Pack
Description:
Includes:

5 wooden pill bottles (for use with the maternity expansion and alternatives for the punchboard ones from the base game)
1 helicopter mini
1 parking garage (base game upgrade)
1 screen printed birthing die
new round tracker (base game upgrade)
4 wooden syringes (base game upgrade)
5th player expansion

The 5th Player expansion adds everything you'll need to play the base game and the other expansions with a 5th player including:

A new player hospital
Extra nurse meeples
Extra score tracker
Extra Dice

The Helicopter from the Community Care expansion acts as ambulance '0' -  the 6th ambulance for a 5 player game.

These will not be included in the retail version of the game but will be available to non backers at conventions and directly from the publisher's store at a much higher price.

Name: Zombicide: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Pack #1
Description: Cool Mini or Not and IDW Games combine together to provide a set of survivors from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe.  This convention exclusive pack includes Leonardo, Donatello, Shredder, and Krang.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Zombicide: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Pack #2
Description: Cool Mini or Not and IDW Games combine together to provide a set of survivors from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe.  This convention exclusive pack includes Raphael, Michaelangelo, Bebop, and Rocksteady.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Cube Route
Description:
The Dice routing game by Vantage Point.

Ages 9 through adult.  2 players or teams.
How you roll the dice cube really counts!
One roll backward... three left... two forward
the choice is yours.
The most strategic route wins the game!!

Object: The first player to move their six dice to the goal wins.
Strategy: Top number on die specifies how many spaces it may be moved (rolled) each turn.  Select best routes to reach goal before opponent.

Name: Big Time Horse Racing
Description:
Six horse owners get together annually to race their best thoroughbreds – for a little money, but mainly for bragging rights. There are three races and three strict bets. The most money wins.

Unlike similar table-top games, in Big Time the luck element is minimized. Sure, you’ll have a “stable” of horses, but you won’t roll dice and check your horse card to see how far your steed goes. And you won’t spend your time making multiple bets on which horse will win the race, either. What you will do is focus on the race itself, and your share of the purse

Big Time Horse Racing is a thinking person’s game. The types of horses in a race, the length of the race, post position and how the race will be run are the important factors. On each turn, players will carefully choose a card to play from their hands – but only one card will determine the results which will apply to all the horses on the racetrack. Sometimes you’ll want your card to be chosen, and sometimes you won’t. Sometimes you’ll try to hinder other players instead of helping yourself. Sometimes you’ll benefit all horses of your type, and sometimes you’ll selfishly give yourself a bonus at the expense of those horses.

You’ll also have to decide when to hold your horse back, when to “make your move,” what to do in the turns, and even if you’ll hand the race to an opponent if you can’t finish in the money. There is betting, but it’s limited, and thought will be required here, too – if you want to win the day!

—description from the designer

Name: Show-Me
Description:
Played much like dominoes for points. The twists is that the wooden tiles are labeled like cards. Set of 14 tiles in each of the suits (Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs and spades), and from A to deuce. There are also doubles of the suit tiles. The game is played for points.

—user summary

Show-Me is a game played with Dominocards.

THE NEW MISSOURI GAME OF "SHOW-ME"
Copyrighted 1907

Is played with Dominocards by any number up to 10. Each player draws 5 pieces. The highest double leads, but if no double out, then the highest numeral leads. Plays to left. After first hand lead goes to left of dealer. Second and following leads made with any piece. For player, the double Heart counts 20; Double Diamond, 15; Double Spade, 10; Double Club, 5. Rank of suit is in same relative order. In the end to end matching suit must match suit, but letters and numerals match without regard to suit or color. Matching is done on four sides of first Double played only. The object is to count multiples of 5 by addition of all ends on board, numerals and Doubles only counted, suit and letters same as blank. Each player in turn counts while multiple of 5 appears. Count is forfeited unless claimed in turn of play. Players unable to match must take up to three draws from board, then play or pass. The first player exhausting hand or holding fewest numerals, if play is blocked, exclaims "Show-me," wins the trick and takes credit for total of numerals held by all other players, in multiple of 5. Up to 4 players game is 250; over four 150 points.

Name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water - The Palace of Puppets
Description:
For many years the Mayamoto and Bashimon Clans have waged war on one another. Now, far behind the lines of embattled troops, Okko and his companions find themselves in possession of documents that could irrevocably change the course of the conflict.

But beware, the constant unrest serves to mask the schemes of the Oni of the Jigoku, who will stop at nothing to preserve the bloddy status quo.

This expansion offers:

     2 new heroes, including Isako and Legendary Kubban
     The rules to control a Bunraku
     An epic campaign that follows Okko and his companions as they try to unravel the machinations of the Clan Ataku.


—description from the publisher

Name: Eyedentity
Description: Eyedentity is a logo & brand identification game, similar to 'The Logo Board Game'

Name: Colonial Marines: Bug Hunt
Description:
Colonial Marines: Bug Hunt is an intense cooperative combat game for 1-8 players. Each player portrays a grunt from a squad of colonial space marines that find themselves in repeated close encounters with classic sci-fi/horror xenomorphs. Missions range from simple get-out-alive or search-and-rescue, to elaborate multi-scenario campaigns.

Each player has a pool of colored dice based on his grunt's skills and attributes. He gains access to more dice and more colors as he levels-up. Players choose and roll dice from their pool, then take actions as allowed by those rolls. The xenomorphs move and attack automatically, triggered by those same dice. Play is simultaneous and in real-time, so the pace of the action can be intense and proceeds as quickly as players can roll and apply results!

Cards to buff each grunt add a dizzying variety of perks, special abilities, and hi-tech gear. But the hidden beauty of Colonial Marines: Bug Hunt is its innovative dice combat system that brings true wargame tactics to a genre dominated by entries that are rich in theme but light on strategy.

—description from the designer

Name: Flames of War: Hit the Beach
Description:
Hit The Beach 
The Complete World War II Starter Set

With a thunderous crash another shell smashes into the wall above you, showering your trench with rubble. Looking around, your entire position resembles a cauldron of fire—every roof ablaze, black smoke billowing into the night sky. As the echo of the blast dies away, the crack of rifle fire breaks out, and an ominous clanking and rumbling… Suddenly, out of the flames roars a Tiger tank! Leaping from your trench you run forwards. ‘Bazooka! Bazooka, now!’ Even as the din swallows your shouting, you see a trooper levelling his rocket launcher at the great beast’s tracks. It may not be enough. You are in command. Take control. What are your orders?

—description from the publisher

Name: Fidget Factory
Description:
The shipping deadline is looming, and you have a slew of logistics, eager customers, and trolls vying for your attention. You were not prepared for this, and you'll need to rapidly ramp up operations to rise to the occasion.

Fidget Factory is a fast-paced, chaotically fun co-op game in which you and other members of a small startup scramble to make and deliver a product before time — and your coffee — runs out.

Each player is given a unique hat to wear, which translates into a special power or restriction. At the start of each turn, you choose whether to keep your hat or exchange it for another from the table. Roll the number of dice your hat allows, and choose which tasks you'll complete with your resources: time and cash. Trade in three-of-a-kind tasks to purchase a new Fidget Cube side; each new side that is assembled onto the Fidget Cube makes it increasingly powerful as the game progresses.

Top this off with trolls who are set on stealing your dice and hindering your productivity, and you'll find that the only path to victory is by working together with your fellow co-founder(s).

You win the game if you and your co-founder(s) build a full Fidget Cube (all six sides) before the shipping deadline hits.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Spike! Journal #6
Description:
The mysterious and deadly Wood Elves enter the fray in Spike! Journal 6. L. Ron Elfman signs on as Guest Editor (after expressing some misgivings about the amount of wood pulp that went into this print run) to bring you some insider info.

If you want to put on a show, dancing across the pitch, pulling off impressive feats of speed and agility, the Wood Elves are for you. Find an ancient (but sturdy) tree and clamber into its arboreal embrace with this fine volume to spend an afternoon learning about the forest dwellers of Athel Loren.

Read about the rich history of these unlikely Blood Bowl favorites, including insight into the wide variety of strange woodland Spites, Treemen and Dryads that cheer them on (and sometimes join them)! They’re the proverbial glass dagger, hitting hard and fast, but crumpling under pressure if they’re not handled carefully. Don’t worry, we’ve got tactical tips from the experts to help you along, as well as all the rules you need to field them and their host of bizarre Star Players, plus the usual hilarious columns and the latest instalment of the Mighty Blow! comic strip.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Wood Elf Team Card Pack
Description:
This essential deck of 44 cards will speed up your games and help you focus on the fun stuff, instead of looking up your rules in the book. Use the cards to help you remember stats, Star Player special abilities, Magical Memorabilia and Benefits of Training. Wood Elf teams have some tremendous tricks up their sleeves, so make sure you're taking advantage of them!

CONTENTS
– Reference cards for Wood Elf Lineman, Catcher, Thrower, Wardancer and Treeman
– Reference cards for Star Players like Willow Rosebark, Jordell Freshbreeze, and Zolcath the Zoat
– Blank cards that you can use to create your own players
– A team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
– 3 Magical Memorabilia cards: Heartwood Armour, Boots of the Wild Punt, and Warpaint of Displacement
– 3 Benefits of Training cards: Leaf on the Wind, Sprig off the Old Block, and Barking up the Wrong Tree
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Wood Elf Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
Nature can be serene and idyllic, or mysterious and dangerous – so too with the wild and aloof Wood Elf teams. The Wood Elf pitch features an arboreal sanctuary, replete with trees and vegetation in full summer bloom, inhabited by an assortment of birds and woodland creatures. Zones are marked by tree roots peeking through the loam, and there’s a large Wood Elf symbol in the centre of the pitch.

Flip the board to discover the same scene, but transported in time to agreeable autumnal colours with glowing sunlight, trees in full color, and a warm, welcoming palette.

The package includes two double-sided dugouts to match the style of the pitch. Each dugout features the usual score tracker, Reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury boxes, touchdown trackers for both halves, and a re-roll tracker. You'll also find rules to represent the particular features of both sides of the pitch.

—description from the publisher

Name: Adidoku: Marylin y Arte
Description:
Adidoku is a new generation of puzzles with a fun mix of characters, places and phrases. Guess the connections and stimulate your brain !

To resolve Adidoku (puzzle), distribute on a table all the pieces showing the "Arts" tiles side. Connect the pieces by checking the words and phrases that seem related. For example: connect "Freddy" with "Mercury" or "Frida" with "Kahlo".

"KBZ Agent" Mini game included. In KBZ agent after 8 rounds the winner is who have more victory points, to achieve this you must solve the concepts of your opponents or have own concepts solved by opponents. The funny stuff is that every concept have forbidden words, time limit, and every tile is a weird letter, those you must use to make your concepts

For example:  Concept: Toothbrush (Forbidden: Mouth, paste, wash)

Word Keys: 3 times a day

Name: Seal Hunting in Alaska
Description:
The game contains: 5 yellow figures (hunters) and 11 red figures (representing seals).
At the start the hunters are placed at the end of the board on which there are 5 red squares and the seals are placed on the 2 rows of red squares at the other end of the board.
The object of the game is for the person playing the seals to get at least 5 of them across the board and land them on the 5 red squares at the opposite end of the board, without being captured by the hunters. The object of the hunters being to capture at least 7 of the seals, to prevent 5 of them getting across.
Both sides move diagonally on the red squares. The 11 seals moving always forward and the 5 hunters moving either backward or forward.
If the person playing the seals succeeds in getting 5 o f them across the board, he may continue to play with any others that still remain on the board, although he has won the game as soon as he has succeeded with 5. The same rule applies to the person playing the hunters, if he succeeds in capturing 7 seals, he may still continue to play and try to capture the remaining 4.

—user summary

Name: The Drowned Earth: Oviraptors
Description:
Oviraptors are faction neutral, and so can be used with any other factions, or as NPC models in certain scenarios or using the Alternate Rules found in the hard copy of the rulebook.

Oviraptors (x2), is a pack of two multi-part metal wargaming miniatures in 35mm scale. The models are lead free, and come supplied with two 30mm base and one profile card.

Name: The Drowned Earth: The Artefacters Fraction Starter Set
Description:
Treasure hunters, tomb robbers, adventurers, scavengers and rogues: an Artefacter cuts a glamorous, but undoubtedly nefarious, figure. Often dashing, brave to the point of recklessness, and willing to risk their life for personal gain. They can be found wandering the wilds for valuable artefacts from a bygone age, from which, they hope to become fabulously rich... 
However, there is more to these ambiguous figures than the mercenary opportunist image they project. Underneath the gloss of avarice and roguish indifference lies a secret… 
Few know the truth, but there are rumours that the Artefacters hold to a higher purpose. There are even whispers that they are agents of the ‘New Enlightenment’...

—description from the publisher

Name: Drama Pukul 7
Description: Drama Pukul 7 is a for 2-6 players card game. The game is a competitive game set in a typical Malaysian/Malay soap opera or drama tv show where all the player compete among themselves by shaming (attack) other player to completely destroy each other's Dignity/Face Value (HP).

Name: Dryads VS Riches
Description:
For generations humanity has ripped up and sawn down the forests of the world.  The woodland elders always tell the saplings that patience is the way of the dryads and that their roots will cover the human's graves, but the sap is running high and some of the more hotheaded sprigs have decided to take matters into their own roots.

Players take the part of dryads trying to rob a bank with the roots by busting through the vault floor.  Game play is based on drafting dice results to draw roots into the game board, seeking out the bank's money sacks.  In competitive mode the dryads compete to gain the most money, or a co-op and solo mode sees them trying to claim the sacks before the humans remove them all.

It was created for and entered into the 2019 one page BGG design contest.

—description from the designer

Name: Don't Get Me Started
Description:
Don’t Get Me Started (DGMS) is a card game where players rant to get as much off their chest as they can.

Players take turns being the ‘hater’. Each round starts with the hater revealing the top rant card from the deck for everyone to see. Read aloud the topics if you’re playing with a large group. There are 3 connected topics on each rant card, ranging from easy to hard (in terms of hateability).

Players progress through different rounds and earn cards along the way. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: TMsg Pro Basketball
Description:
Using player cards and your computer, TMsg Pro Basketball simulates the professional basketball coaching experience.  Players perform realistically and will have an impact on your decisions.

The game is won by having the right players on the floor and utilizing strategy options available to the pro basketball coach.  TMsg is an immersive coaching simulation using actual pro basketball rules.

TMsg Pro Basketball captures the excitement of the pro game. It flows smoothly. No cumbersome charts are needed as all action is resolved by your computer. The game is timed; stats are recorded; player minutes are tracked and all information needed to make wise coaching decisions are at hand on the well layed-out game screen.  Although complex internally and comprised of exacting detail, TMsg Pro Basketball plays in under one hour.  The combination of the player cards and the TMsg Pro Basketball Game and Utilities package plays the game, tracks statistics, and allows you to create leagues and draft teams from available players.

—description from the publisher

Name: What Ho!: The Skirmish Game
Description:
What Ho! is a skirmish game of non-violent conflicts.  It is set in the drawing rooms, ballrooms, village lanes and cottage gardens of a rural England of a past age.  Players will involve themselves in the farces of P.G. Wodehouse or investigations of Agatha Christie.  Unlike many skirmish games which begin with many uninteresting choices and end with a few interesting ones as the game crystallises but combatants are removed in What Ho! breadth of choice remains as their impact comes into view.

Players move miniatures around a playing surface of their choice, gaining plotlines by building up hidden dice and then attempt to complete actions to achieve their plotline objectives. What Ho! is a non-violent miniatures skirmish game based on movement and miniature placement.

—description from the designer

Name: Vilar de Mouros 2019
Description:
Vilar de Mouros 2019 is the 2nd expansion for Vilar de Mouros with 8 new cards (7 game cards and 1 bonus card).
One of the new game cards (Skunk Anansie) is an upgrade, so we recommend that you play without the original one.
With the 2 expansions, we have now 99 game cards and 20 bonus cards, so we recommend that all players begin with 2 more game cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Ride Darryl
Description:
"Ride" Daryl includes a miniature of Daryl riding his motorcycle, three new Daryl survivor cards, and a scenario sheet with 10 new event cards.

In this Kickstarter-exclusive expansion, the players will use Daryl to draw the walkers away from the group while the other members of the group get down to business.

Note: "Ride" Daryl is actually included in the Kickstarter edition of the base game, but was also offered as an add-on.

Name: Brutality Character pack: Trajan, the Righteous Executioner & Atticus Kilgore, Leviathan Hunter
Description:
2 characters for Brutality (miniature and card each)

Trajan, the Righteous Executioner is a tank-type, with a 2 wide base, 24HP, 3 MS (move points)
Attacks are-
Relentless Slice, hits 3 spaces (1 wide) in a straight line for 2 damage to any opponents.
Gutted and Hanged, hits 3 spaces in a straight line (2 wide if forward or back) with 1 damage to each space, and causes "hanged" status, requiring 1 move point or receive a knockback to get free or they will take 1 damage..

Atticus Kilgore, Leviathan Hunter is a Damage-type, regular (1x1) base, 20 HP, 3 MS (move points)
Attacks are - 
Dead On, Throws a harpoon 3 spaces in any direction then pulls himself in front of where it lands. they hit for 1 damage, pinning the enemy., if it lands on an enemy he will cause 1 damage and knockback.
Harpoon Fury, hits the adjacent spaces front/back (2damage), diagonals & sides (1 damage)
Salty Gouge, hits an adjacent space for 2 damage & knock back..

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse
Description:
Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse is a game of massive battles set in the grim darkness of the far future. If you've ever wanted to field an entire Space Marine Battle Company or household of Imperial Knights (and more besides), then this is the game for you!

As with Battle-forged armies in Warhammer 40,000, your collections are organised into any of 10 different types of Detachment (and each led by a Commander) that move and fight together on the battlefield. Each Detachment also gains a Faction Ability, enabling you to theme your army by Detachment and include narrative-driven alliances within it.

The innovative rules for Apocalypse enable you to play massive battles to completion in a matter of hours. Alternating Detachment activations ensures that there is minimal downtime for players, maintaining the fast-paced and exciting action throughout. Damage is resolved in the final phase of each game turn, meaning that even units that are destroyed will still have a chance to make their mark on the battle before they succumb.

In each turn, players issue Advance, Aimed Fire or Assault orders in secret to each of their Detachments, giving them a chance to bluff, surprise and outmanoeuvre their opponents with their choices.

Each player constructs a deck of 30 Command Assets (from a choice of 300 included in the set), including a number of faction-specific cards, enabling them to pull off strategic power plays as the battle unfolds. These effects include devastating psychic powers, changes of orders and crucial re-rolls.

There are six Apocalypse missions to choose from, as well as a mission generator with which to create your own.

This set contains:
- 120-page Apocalypse Field Manual (including full game rules)
- 6 punchboard sheets of double-sided Apocalypse gameplay tokens
- 300 Command Asset cards
- 12 six-sided dice
- 12 twelve-sided dice

Name: Sky Magic
Description:
A powerful storm is brewing, so help the five enchanted friends get home before they run out of magic spells!

In Sky Magic, kids work as a team to navigate around storm clouds and avoid falling through the sky when the board shifts. Plan carefully, and use your magic wisely as the game continuously shifts! Kids learn strategy, co-operation, and communication.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brutality Character Pack: Rong'oth, Demon King, Spiked wall & Limestone wall ruins
Description:
1 character for Brutality (miniature & card) & 2 3D scenery pieces

Rang'oth is a Tank-type, with a 3 wide base, 27HP, 3MS (move points)
Attacks are - 
Demonic Leap, He moves up to 2 spaces in any direction, enemies underneath the path take 1 damage, if he lands on enemies they take an additional damage and are knocked back.
Slash and Impale, hits 2 middle spaces forward & 3 spaces directly in front of him (can attack in any orthogonal direction). hits for 1 damage & 1 bleed per space.
Crushing Subjugation, Attacks an opponent on an adjacent space for 1 damage, then can move them 1 space, if the opponent hits another opponent, they both take an additional damage.

3D scenery has the same rules as the rule book

Name: Brutality Character pack: Crowley, the Plague Baron & Mary the Brutal
Description:
2 characters for Brutality (miniature and card each)

Crowley is a Utility-type, with regular base, 20HP, 3MS (move points)
Attacks are- 
Corpse Pox, places corpse pox tiles on to any space adjacent to him, these persist for 4 turns and do 1 damage to opponents that move on or through them.
Plagues Rats, attacks 3 spaces in one direction with 2 damage and knockback to opponents.

Mary is a tank-type, with a 2 wide base, 25HP & 3 MS (move points)
Attacks are -
Skull Smash, She charges forward 2 spaces, with 2 damage and knockback to any spaces touched.
Overhead Sword Swing, She hits all adjacent spaces for 1 damage each
Face Breaker, She hits all adjacent spaces for 1 damage, knockback and bleed.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Command Assets
Description:
This deck of 100 additional Command Asset cards is designed to expand upon the 300 Command Assets included with Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. The new cards are divided between universal cards that are usable by any faction, as well as cards that are tailored to each of the individual factions that feature in Apocalypse. Regardless of your allegiance, these additional Command Assets offer a huge variety of new tactical options.

This card set requires a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse to use.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Astra Militarum
Description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Astra Militarum Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the Astra Militarum faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Astra Militarum Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:

- Lord Castellan Creed
- Colour Sergeant Kell

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Aeldari
Description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Aeldari Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the Aeldari factions. Also included is a Faction card that details the various faction rules that apply to Asuryani, Drukhari, Ynnari and Harlequins Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:

Asuryani:
- Eldrad Ulthran

Aeldari
- Webway Gate

This datacard set requires a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse to use.

Name: 18OR
Description:
18OR is game about railroad investing in Oregon. Players invest in and operate railroad companies for profit or peril. Companies will lay railroad track, build routes, and run trains on while attempting to block rival companies from doing so. The player with the greatest wealth at the end of the game is the winner.

18OR is designed to be scalable and configurable. It comes with several different map sizes to support 2-8 players. Maps can be rearranged to create any scenario.

18OR is rather different from other games in the genera. Many of the components are the same but play differently.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse – Datasheet Cards: Orks
Description:
A set of Datasheets specifically designed for using your Orks Citadel miniatures in games of Warhammer 40,000: Apocalypse. Each datacard provides the full rules and profiles for a single unit from the Orks faction. Also included is a Faction card that details the faction rules that apply to Orks Detachments. The reverse side of each card features the faction’s icon.

The set includes datacards for the following units:

- Ghazghkull Thraka
- Warboss
- Big Mek
- Weirdboy
- Boss Snikrot
- Boss Zagstruk
- Deffkilla Wartrike
- Kaptin Badrukk
- Boyz
- Gretchin
- Mad Dok Grotsnik
- Painboy
- Mek
- Burna Boyz
- Tankbustas
- Nobz
- Nob with Waaagh! Banner
- Meganobz
- Nobz on Warbikes
- Kommandos
- Warbikers
- Kustom Boosta-Blastas
- Shokkjump Dragstas 
- Boomdakka Snazzwagons
- Megatrakk Scrapjets
- Rukkatrukk Squigbuggies
- Stormboyz
- Mek Gun
